name: corrugated board box production | corrugated board box | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25334/documentation

This dataset represents US-average corrugated products (e.g., corrugated box). It includes a share of recycled and virgin corrugating medium and linerboard inputs. Corrugated products are made of corrugated board (combined board). Corrugated board is the structure formed by bonding one or more sheets of fluted corrugating medium to one or more flat facings of linerboard. When this consists of a single facing, it is referred to as single-face board. If bonded on both sides, it becomes double-faced or single wall corrugated board. In addition to singlewall board, doublewall and triplewall corrugated boards are also produced. Typically, corrugated products are used as secondary packaging of products for shipping. The average basis weight of the U.S. industry mix is 131.6 lb/thousand square feet (msf, 0.643 kg/m2) and consists of approximately 0.6% singleface, 90.9% singlewall, 8.0% doublewall, and 0.5% triplewall.

The process starts with the feeding of linerboard and corrugated medium to converting facilities. There are three types of converting facilities: corrugator plants, sheet feeder plants and sheet plants. Corrugator plants assemble linerboard and corrugating medium into corrugated sheets, and convert sheets into corrugated products (e.g., boxes) at the same location. Some corrugator plants also act as sheet feeder or sheet plants. Sheet feeder plants assemble linerboard and corrugating medium into corrugated sheets and ship them for final conversion into boxes or other corrugated products, mostly to sheet plants but also, in some cases, to corrugator plants. Sheet plants convert corrugated sheets produced mainly in sheet feeder plants, but also in some corrugator plants, into corrugated products. The ratio of corrugated products from corrugator plants is 80.4% vs. 19.6% for sheet plants.

This activity ends with the printing and cutting of corrugated sheets into unfolded boxes which are then ready for delivery.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1702:Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper a

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Converting facilities provided air emission data for NOx, VOCs, SO2 and total particulates. The remaining emissions were estimated using ecoinvent combustion processes and fuel quantities. Distillate fuel oil: Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CA-QC}| heat production, light fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW, Gasoline and kerosene: Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CA-QC}| heat production, light fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW, LPG: Heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas {CA-QC}| heat production, propane, at industrial furnace >100kW and natural gas: Heat, district or industrial, natural gas {CA-QC}| heat production, natural gas, at industrial furnace >100kW.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data obtained from 166 US converting facilities including: 128 corrugator plants, 7 sheet feeder plants and 31 sheet plants. Percent representativeness was determined based on the containerboard input.
